001package org.parboiled.examples.indenting;
002
003import org.parboiled.buffers.IndentDedentInputBuffer;
004import org.parboiled.errors.ErrorUtils;
005import org.parboiled.parser.Parboiled;
006import org.parboiled.parserunners.ReportingParseRunner;
007import org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
008import org.parboiled.parserunners.ReportingParseRunner;
009import org.parboiled.support.ParseTreeUtils;
010import org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
011
012import static org.parboiled.support.ParseTreeUtils.printNodeTree;
013
014public class Main {
015
016    public static void main(String[] args) {
017        SimpleIndent parser = Parboiled.createParser(SimpleIndent.class);
018        String input = "NodeA \n\tNodeB\n\tNodeC \n\t\tNodeD \nNodeE";
019
020        ParsingResult<?> result = new ReportingParseRunner(parser.Parent())
021                .run(new IndentDedentInputBuffer(input.toCharArray(), 2, ";", true, true));
022
023        if (!result.parseErrors.isEmpty()) {
024            System.out.println(ErrorUtils.printParseError(result.parseErrors
025                    .get(0)));
026        } else {
027            System.out.println("NodeTree: " + ParseTreeUtils.printNodeTree(result) + '\n');
028            Object value = result.parseTreeRoot.getValue();
029            System.out.println(value.toString());
030        }
031
032    }
033}
